item.title: Operations Dashboard
item.description:
Note: this page is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Operations Dashboard for ArcGIS

Operations Dashboard is a WYSIWYG web tool that allows you to easily build interactive dashboards that provides location-aware data visualization and analytics.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Getting started
  • Training
    • Documentation
    • Tutorials
    • Videos
    • Slides
  • Get the tool
  • Coding
    • Code
  • Awesome projects and cool demos
  • Support and Community
    • People you should know
  • News
  • Additional resources
    • Related products or technologies
    • ArcGIS Online content
    • Localized resources
      • Spanish
  • Partners and startups
  • Contributions

Introduction

Take a look to the Official landing page.

Operations Dashboard used to be a desktop tool that could be extended using the ArcGIS API for JavaScript though an operation view, but now it is not, but you still have Web AppBuilder Developer Edition + Dashboard Theme if you need to do that.

Getting started

ArcGIS Solutions Gallery offer a bunch of options for ready-to-use maps, surveys, preconfigured applications, maps and feature layers... where you can filter by industry, products/applications and implementation patterns to jumpstart your work.

Training

Documentation

  • Operations Dashboard documentation
  • Operations Dashboard training courses
  • Do-It-Yourself Geo Apps (MOOC - Section 3)
  • Deprecated: Extend Operations Dashboard (Desktop)

Tutorials

Lessons:

  • Monitor Real-Time Emergencies (1h 20min)
  • Oversee Snowplows in Real Time (1h 15min)
  • Collect Hurricane Damage Assessments (1h)

Path:

  • Try Field Operations (3h 20min)

Article:

  • Provide Context to Your Dashboard Indicators (20min)

Videos

We have created an Operations Dashboard Youtube playlist that we think it might be worth to you to save (how to save a Youtube Playlist).

On video.esri.com you will find and Esri Events you will find many technical talks.

Event Title Length
DevSummit 2019 What's New in Operations Dashboard for ArcGIS 58min 29secs
DevSummit 2019 Operations Dashboard for ArcGIS: Tips and Tricks 24min 47secs
User Conference 2018 Operations Dashboard for ArcGIS: An Introduction 58min 6secs
DevSummit 2018 Operations Dashboard Tip and Tricks 33min 07secs
DevSummit 2018 What's New in Operations Dashboard for ArcGIS 57min 1secs
User Conference 2017 Operations Dashboard for ArcGIS: An Introduction 1h 13min 28secs
DevSummit 2017 Developing Custom Extensions in Operations Dashboard for ArcGIS 52min 34secs

You might also find interesting videos at Esri Industries, ArcGIS, EsriTV, Esri R&D Center etc

Slides

More slides in proceedings.esri.com or check on geonet.

Get the tool

You can start using Operations Dashboard with your free Developer Subscription.

It is also included with and ArcGIS Online Organization account and with any of the ArcGIS Developer Plans (it is also provided as part of the Startup Program).

Learn more about: account types

Coding

Code

  • JavaScript:
    • operations-dashboard-utils: operations-dashboard-utils
    • dashboard-samples: Using the ArcGIS API for JavaScript, you can develop widget, map tools, and feature action extensions for Operations Dashboard running on Windows and in a browser.
    • workflowmanager-dashboard-samples: Sample Workflow Manager widgets inside the Operations Dashboard
    • production-dashboard-js: A collection of Javascript Operations Dashboard widgets that utilize Workflow Manager Server and Data Reviewer Server to visualize data about your organization.
  • C#:
    • solutions-widgets-wpf: Solutions Widgets for use in the ArcGIS WPF Operations Dashboard.
    • tableandsearch-opsdashboard-addin: Add-in for Operations Dashboard for ArcGIS containing a table widget and search nearby feature action. Additional tools may be added in future.
    • MapSketch-AttributeTable-CensusReport-opsdashboard-addin: An Operations Dashboard addin with a sketch map tool, a census report feature action, and an attribute table widget
    • more repos

Awesome projects and cool demos

Real projects:

  • Tompkins County, NY
  • Will County, IL
  • Meath County Council, Ireland
  • Orange County Environmental Resources
  • City of Vancouver, BC, Canada
  • Massachusetts Emergency Management Agency (MEMA)
  • National Information Sharing Consortium (NISC)
  • Maryland Dept of Transportation
  • Emergency Spatial Support Center (Esri Indonesia)
  • St Johns County Public Works, FL

Demo Apps:

  • Snowplow Monitoring
  • Water Quality dashboard
  • Crime data dashboard
  • Wireless Network dashboard

Find more awesome projects and cool demos in the Awesome ArcGIS organization in ArcGIS Online.

Support and Community

If needed, remember you can always check the Technical Support Website for developer products and the Technical Support Blog at GeoNet to find additional resources.

Community channels:

Please go visit: Operations Dashboard for ArcGIS Place on GeoNet

* If needed: already [answered questions on GeoNet](https://community.esri.com/community/gis/applications/operations-dashboard-for-arcgis/content?filterID=contentstatus%5Bpublished%5D~objecttype~thread%5Bquestions%5D~thread%5Banswered%5D)

Vote/share the ideas about Operations Dashboard @ ArcGIS Ideas on GeoNet

People you should know

Please find the ArcGIS Experts on this topic using this tool:

They don't work on the support team and some may even not work at Esri, but they are opening some projects and sharing insights related to this technology so we recommend you to follow them.

News

  • Some Example Operations Dashboard for ArcGIS Apps & Resources
  • Dashboard tips that will make you say, “I didn’t know I could do that!”

More news:

  • "Operations Dashboard" esri.com/arcgis-blog
  • "Operations Dashboard" at esri.com search engine
  • Blog Posts about "Operations Dashboard" inside Places at GeoNet

Additional resources

  • Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "Operations Dashboard".

  • There is also an Awesome ArcGIS organization in ArcGIS Online, explore the groups or items

Related products or technologies

  • Web AppBuilder also have a dashboard theme: if you need a highly customized dashboard web encourage you to consider extending this using the developer edition.

List of all Esri products in the "Esri Products - ArcGIS Platform" group

ArcGIS Online content

Operations Dashboard items in ArcGIS Online:

  • Authoritative Operations Dashboards
  • Scripts%20(type%3A%22code%20samples%22%20OR%20type%3A%22add-ins%22%20OR%20type%3A%22geoprocessing%20samples%22)%20-type%3A%22Code%20Attachment%22%20-type%3A%22Featured%20Items%22%20-type%3A%22Symbol%20Set%22%20-type%3A%22Color%20Set%22%20-type%3A%22Windows%20Viewer%20Add%20In%22%20-type%3A%22Windows%20Viewer%20Configuration%22&start=1&num=20&sortOrder=desc&sortField=modified)

You might also find interesting content from some Esri users or groups in ArcGIS Online.

Search Operations Dashboard related items in ArcGIS Online

Localized resources

Spanish

  • Introducción a Operations Dashboard
  • Webinar Apps ArcGIS
  • Integración Koop + Operations Dashboard - Conferencia Esri 2018
  • Dashboard para monitorizar el tráfico en tiempo real en España

Partners and startups

Do you know any partner or startup you can had with expertise with this product?, learn how to contribute in less than a minute

Contributions

Feel free to improve/extend this resource page using this template (Contribution Guide).

item.title: Streetmap Premium
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

StreetMap Premium for ArcGIS

Add data from StreetMap Premium for ArcGIS to your ArcGIS software so you can display, geocode, route, and deploy street data on-premises, behind your firewall. Data is available for areas around the world.

item.title: Survey123
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Survey123 for ArcGIS

It is an native (Android, iOS, Windows, OS X and Linux) and web app builder that allow you to create smart forms to collect data anywhere at anytime.

Table of contents

  • Survey123 Online version
  • Survey123 Native version
  • Getting started
  • Training
    • Videos
  • Community
  • News
  • People you should know
  • Additional resources
    • Related products or technologies
    • Localized resources
      • Spanish
  • Contributions

Survey123 Online version

Online version

Survey123 Native version

In order to be able to create and share surveys you can also use Survey123 Connect for Windows, macOS and Linux.

To complete surveys and get answers you can use Survey123 for ArcGIS for Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS, and Windows Phone versions.

Download any of these versions here.

Getting started

ArcGIS Solutions Gallery offer a bunch of options for ready-to-use maps, surveys, preconfigured applications, maps and feature layers... where you can filter by industry, products/applications and implementation patterns to jumpstart your work.

Training

  • Survey123 Help

Survey123 Native version

In order to be able to create and share surveys you can also use Survey123 Connect for Windows, macOS and Linux.

To complete surveys and get answers you can use Survey123 for ArcGIS for Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS, and Windows Phone versions.

Download any of these versions here.

Getting started

ArcGIS Solutions Gallery offer a bunch of options for ready-to-use maps, surveys, preconfigured applications, maps and feature layers... where you can filter by industry, products/applications and implementation patterns to jumpstart your work.

Training

  • Survey123 Help
  • Survey123 Online version FAQ
  • Understanding Survey123's custom URL Scheme

Videos

  • Survey123 Online version playlist
  • Survey123 for ArcGIS
  • Example Field Applications of Spike and Esri's Survey123 for ArcGIS

Community

  • Survey123 GeoNet Group
  • Survey123Community Repo: This is the place where you can add your feedback and issues on Survey123.

News

  • GeoNet Blog
    • Understanding Multiple-Choice Questions in Survey123 for ArcGIS
  • @EsriSurvey123 on Twitter
  • Survey123 on blogs.esri.com

People you should know

Please find the ArcGIS Experts on this topic using this tool:

They don't work on the support team and some may even not work at Esri, but they are opening some projects and sharing insights related to this technology so we recommend you to follow them.

Additional resources

Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "Survey123".

Related products or technologies

List of all Esri products in the "Esri Products - ArcGIS Platform" group

Localized resources

Spanish

  • Webinar Apps ArcGIS
  • Demo Survey123 + Spike

Contributions

Feel free to improve/extend this resource page using this template (Contribution Guide).

item.title: Tracker For ArcGIS
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Tracker for ArcGIS

Know the real-time location of your most valued assets, your mobile users. Using Tracker to effortlessly capture location track data and feed it back into ArcGIS, you achieve control and agility to effectively allocate personnel to field needs, even in rapidly changing circumstances.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
    • Videos
    • News
    • Additional resources
      • Related products or technologies
    • Contributions

Introduction

Learn more

Videos

Location Tracking for Field Operations

News

Related products or technologies

item.title: Vector Tile Style Editor
item.description:
Vector Tile Style Editor

It Is an online editor that you can use to style vector tile layers and create custom basemaps for your applications. You can edit any of the colors, labels, and sprites for the different layers present, e.g. land, water, roads, boundaries, and nature, and then save the styles as your own basemaps.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Training
    • Tutorials
    • Videos
  • Support and Community
  • News
  • Additional resources
    • Related products or technologies
  • Contributions

Introduction

Disclaimer: Although this application could be considered a product as such, you will not find any landing page on Esri.com promoting it.

You can access it on through: developers.arcgis.com/vector-tile-style-editor/

Training

Tutorials

  • Style a vector basemap - 10min

Videos

  • Vector Basemaps styling demo ~3min
  • Styling Vector Tiles ~7min
  • Customizing and Styling Vector Basemaps ~1h

Support and Community

If needed, remember you can always check the Technical Support Website for developer products and the Technical Support Blog at GeoNet to find additional resources.

Community channels:

  • ArcGIS Vector Tile Style Editor
    • Content->Questions->Answered questions

News

  • Design custom basemaps with the new ArcGIS Vector Tile Style Editor

Additional resources

Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "Vector Tile Style Editor for ArcGIS".

Related products or technologies

  • Map Services > Vector tiles
  • ArcGIS Pro: It can be used to build vector tile services

List of all Esri products in the "Esri Products - ArcGIS Platform" group

Contributions

Feel free to improve/extend this resource page using this template (Contribution Guide).

item.title: Web AppBuilder
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Web AppBuilder

Web AppBuilder is a WYSIWYG tool that allow any user to build 2D and 3D map-centric apps (with a full screen map) without writing any code. You as a web developer can add new widgets and themes or customize the existing ones.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Getting started
  • Training
    • Videos / Technical talks
  • Awesome projects and cool demos
  • News
  • Additional resources
    • Related products or technologies
    • Localized resources
      • Spanish
  • Contributions

Introduction

Web AppBuilder has two versions:

  • ArcGIS Online and Portal for ArcGIS hosted version (for non-developers): A WYSIWYG tool that allow them to build and export responsive web apps adding and configuring pre-defined widgets and themes.

  • Developer Edition (for developers): It is a self-hosted version but also a framework that can be extended adding custom themes and widgets.

Note: In this page we will focus on the hosted version.

Getting started

ArcGIS Solutions Gallery offer a bunch of options for ready-to-use maps, surveys, preconfigured applications, maps and feature layers... where you can filter by industry, products/applications and implementation patterns to jumpstart your work.

Training

  • Web AppBuilder interface documentation
  • Esri training courses

Videos / Technical talks

On video.esri.com you will find many technical talks and slides from proceedings.esri.com.

Event Title Length
n.a. 2017 Military Tools for ArcGIS in Web AppBuilder: Using Coordinate Conversion 2min 44secs
n.a. 2017 Military Tools for ArcGIS in Web AppBuilder: Using Distance and Direction 2min 24secs
n.a. 2017 Military Tools for ArcGIS in Web AppBuilder: Using Visibility 1min 35secs
DevSummit 2017 [Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS: JavaScript Apps Made Easy](http://www.esri.com/videos/watch?videoid=5hsprKc_Wo0&channelid=UC_yE3TatdZKAXvt_TzGJ6mw&title=web-appbuilder-for-arcgis:-javascript-apps-made-easy 1h 7min 19secs
UC 2016 Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS: Build Web Apps with No Coding 1h 13min 53secs

And of course you can search the most viewed Web AppBuilder videos on Youtube.

Awesome projects and cool demos

Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS - Live Sites Showcase

* [App](https://www.arcgis.com/apps/MapAndAppGallery/index.html?appid=1e3085af6e1a48c8908fa624bdfef768)

News

  • Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS - Blog posts at GeoNet

Additional resources

Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "Web AppBuilder".

Related products or technologies

List of all Esri products in the "Esri Products - ArcGIS Platform" group

Localized resources

Spanish

  • Webinar Apps ArcGIS

Contributions

Feel free to improve/extend this resource page using this template (Contribution Guide).

item.title: Developer Edition
item.description:
Note: this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS (Developer Edition)

Web AppBuilder Developer Edition is a WYSIWYG tool that allow any user to build 2D and 3D map-centric apps (with a full screen map) without writing any code. You as a web developer can add new widgets and themes or customize the existing ones.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Training
    • Videos / Technical talks
  • Download
  • Support and Community
  • Code
  • People you should know
  • News
  • More resources
  • Resources in other languages
  • Localized resources
    • Spanish

Introduction

If you are not a developer please skip to the Web AppBuilder hosted version.

The builder itself is written in NodeJS and can be downloaded from the developer console but you will need at least to have a free account in order to be able to download it.

In this page you will find some sites you can use to improve your skills to be able to extend Web AppBuilder.

Training

First resources you should know are:

  • Developers site documentation
  • Esri training courses

Videos / Technical talks

We have created a Web AppBuilder Youtube playlist that we think it might be worth to you to save (how to save a Youtube Playlist).

Check Esri Geodev - Web AppBuilder playlist

On video.esri.com you will find many technical talks and slides from proceedings.esri.com.

Event Title Length
DevSummit 2019 Web AppBuilder: An Overview of Editing Capability 32min 06secs
DevSummit 2019 Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS: A Deep Dive into Enterprise Deployment 56min 16secs
DevSummit 2019 Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS: What's New and What's Coming 1h 7secs
DevSummit 2019 Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS: JavaScript Apps Made Easy 55min 13secs
DevSummit 2019 Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS: Developing for Mobile 56min 42secs
DevSummit 2019 Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS: Customizing and Extending 54min
DevSummit 2019 Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS: Advanced Development tools and Techniques 45min 12secs
DevSummit 2019 Developing Imagery Apps using the ArcGIS API for JavaScript and WebApp Builder 59min 45secs

And of course you can search the most viewed Web AppBuilder videos on Youtube.

Download

You need to sign up in order to be able to download Web AppBuilder Developer Edition.

Support and Community

If needed, remember you can always check the Technical Support Website for developer products and the Technical Support Blog at GeoNet to find additional resources.

Web AppBuilder developers are mainly in GeoNet, you will find developers sharing code and helping other developers here:

  • Custom Widgets GeoNet Group
  • Custom Themes GeoNet Group
  • All Web AppBuilder Groups on GeoNet

Code

  • wab-app-build-script: speed up your app's loading performance
  • Widgets & Themes:
    • Query "Web AppBuilder" on Esri's Github
    • Custom Widgets directory repo
    • Web AppBuilder - The custom widgets links list (3/27/2017)
    • Components for the ArcGIS WebApp Builder repo
    • Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) - Widgets and themes
    • Choose "ArcGIS Web AppBuilder" on ArcGIS Code Sharing
    • webappbuilder-theme-starter
  • Tools:
    • Yeoman generator to help customize Esri's Web AppBuilder | Generating Custom Widgets for Esri’s WebApp Builder with Yeoman
    • This generator was adapted from @steveoh's generator-dojo-widget, @tomwaysons generator-esri-widget and Esri/generator-esri-appbuilder-js
    • Web AppBuilder Dojo Build

People you should know

Please find the ArcGIS Experts (story tellers and developers) on this topic here: https://esri-es.github.io/arcgis-experts/?topic=Web%20AppBuilder%20for%20ArcGIS%20(Developer%20Edition))

They don't work on the support team and some may even not work at Esri, but they are opening some projects and sharing insights related to this technology so we recommend you to follow them.

News

  • blogs.esri.com (tag: Web AppBuilder)
  • Blog posts - GeoNet:
    • Web AppBuilder Custom Widgets Group
    • Web AppBuilder Custom Themes Group

More resources

  • GIS Utils
  • Web AppBuilder Live Sites Showcase - see what others are doing with Web AppBuilder

Resources in other languages

You may find more localized resources in you country, check this list.

Localized resources

Spanish

Además de las noticias sobre algunas novedades de la versión para desarrolladores que encontrarás desarrolladores.esri.es hemos recopilado los siguientes recursos.

  • Troubleshoot Web AppBuilder (Borrador)
  • Charlas técnicas:
    • DevSummit Esri España 2016 - Consejos y herramientas para desarrollar en Web AppBuilder
    • Conferencia Esri España 2015 - Extendiendo Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS
  • Workshops / Talleres / Codelabs
    • Web AppBuilder - Codelab 2015
  • Cursos Esri España
    • Si en lugar de aprender de manera autodidacta buscas una formación completa, guiada y tutorizada te recomendamos:
      • Experto en desarrollo
      • ...

item.title: Web Map Viewer
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Web Map Viewer

The Web Map Viewer is a web tool that allow you to create and modify 2D Web maps though a web browser. It is available on ArcGIS Online and ArcGIS Enterprise.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Training
    • Tutorials
    • Demos
    • Documentation
  • Build apps
  • Localized resources
    • Spanish
  • Additional resources
    • Related products or technologies
  • Contributions

Introduction

Disclaimer: Although this application could be considered a product as such, you will not find any landing page on Esri.com promoting it.

The Web Map Viewer is a web tool that allow you to create and modify Web maps though a web browser. It is available on ArcGIS Online and Portal for ArcGIS.

You can start using the Web Map Viewer on ArcGIS Online without creating an account but if you do, you will be able to able to save what you did, perform analysis, etc.

So I recommend you to sign up for a free account and then login in the Web Map Viewer.

The Web Map Viewer is available in ArcGIS Online and in Portal for ArcGIS as you can see here.

Training

Tutorials

Step by step tutorials:

  • Get started with Web Map Viewer (~90min)
  • Create a web map (2D) (~10min)
  • Style a Web map (~10min)
  • Configure pop-ups (~5min)
  • Style your layers with smart mapping (~10min)

Demos

  • Load multiple variables (7min)
  • Analysis:
    • Aggregate data (11m)
  • Smartmapping:
    • Time based data (7min)

Documentation

  • Web Map Viewer
  • Advanced search options
  • Arcade: You can go to the Arcade page to learn how to use this expression language to create better symbolization as you can see in this video.
  • Viewer URL parameters for maps and embedded maps.
  • Analysis:
    • Summarize data
    • Find locations
    • Data enrichment
    • Analyze patterns
    • Use proximity
    • Manage data

Build apps

After you finish your Web map you can easily create apps combining it with configurable apps, the hosted version on ArcGIS Online or Portal of Web AppBuilder and also with AppStudio basic.

Localized resources

Spanish

  • Introducción a la interfaz de Web Map Viewer
  • Cargar un CSV con coordenadas en ArcGIS Online
  • Simbología y smart mapping en ArcGIS Online
  • ArcGIS Web Map Viewer - WMS, WMTS, vector y tile layers
  • Análisis de áreas de influencia
  • Análisis de geoenriquecimiento

Additional resources

Repo: esri-es/geojson2fs-service: Ready to use service that can be used to transform GeoJSON files into ArcGIS Feature Services on the fly. Useful to load third party GeoJSON datasets been hosted and maintained by the third party into Web Maps using the Web Map Viewer

Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "Web Map Viewer".

Related products or technologies

List of all Esri products in the "Esri Products - ArcGIS Platform" group

Contributions

Feel free to improve/extend this resource page using this template (Contribution Guide).

item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Web Scene Viewer

The Web Scene Viewer is a web tool that allow you to create and modify 3D Web scenes though a web browser. It is available on ArcGIS Online and ArcGIS Enterprise.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Training
    • Tutorials
    • Demos
    • Documentation
    • Examples
  • Build apps
  • Additional resources
    • Related products or technologies
  • Contributions

Introduction

Disclaimer: Although this application could be considered a product as such, you will not find any landing page on Esri.com promoting it.

The Web Scene Viewer is a web tool that allow you to create and modify Web scenes though a web browser. It is available on ArcGIS Online and Portal for ArcGIS.

Training

You can start using the Web Map Viewer on ArcGIS Online without creating an account but if you do, you will be able to able to save what you did, perform analysis, etc.

So I recommend you to sign up for a free account and then login in the Web Map Viewer.

The Web Map Viewer is available in ArcGIS Online and in Portal for ArcGIS as you can see here.

Tutorials

  • Get Started with the Scene Viewer (1h 20min)

Demos

  • ArcGIS Online: Scene Basics (2min)
  • Intro to ArcGIS Scene Viewer (13min)
  • Slides in Scene Viewer (1min 30sec)
  • Add and configuring layers in the Scene Viewer (1min 14secs)
  • Vector tiles, smart mapping, 3D optimized scene layers, 3D web styles, in Web Scene Viewer (3m)

Documentation

  • Get started with scenes
  • View scenes in the scene viewer
  • Scene viewer requirements
  • Create scenes

Examples

  • 3D Web Scene gallery

Build apps

After you finish your Web scene you can easly create apps combining it with configurable apps, the hosted version on ArcGIS Online or Portal of Web AppBuilder and also with AppStudio basic.

Additional resources

Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "Web Scene Viewer".

Related products or technologies

List of all Esri products in the "Esri Products - ArcGIS Platform" group

Contributions

Feel free to improve/extend this resource page using this template (Contribution Guide).

item.title: Workforce
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Workforce for ArcGIS

It is a web and mobile app that can be use to manage your workforce for field inspections, sales leads, service requests, capital improvements, one call tickets, etc.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Training
    • Videos
  • Downloads
  • Code
  • Community
  • News
  • Additional resources
    • Related products or technologies
    • Localized resources
      • Spanish
  • Contributions

Introduction

It enables a common view in the field and the office. Get the right worker to the right place with the right tools to do the right job. Use the web app in the office to create and assign work to mobile workers, who use the mobile app to work through their personal To Do list.

Training

  • Workforce documentation
  • Esri Training: Introduction to Workforce for ArcGIS

Videos

Event Title Length
DevSummit 2017 What is new in Workforce for ArcGIS 1h 3min 51secs
DevSummit 2017 Automating Workforce for ArcGIS with Python 58min 31secs
UC 2016 ArcGIS Apps: Workforce for ArcGIS: Coordinate Your Field Workforce 1h 28min 20secs
Esri Ireland Webinar Getting Started with Workforce for ArcGIS 44min 22secs

Downloads

Apps:

  • Web app
  • Android
  • iOS

Read some user stories

Code

  • A set of scripts to help administer Workforce projects.

Community

  • Workforce GeoNet Group

News

  • Workforce
  • Workforce for ArcGIS (Web App) Released

Additional resources

List of all Esri products in the "Esri Products - ArcGIS Platform" group

item.title: World Geocoder For ArcGIS
item.description:
World Geocoder for ArcGIS

World Geocoder for ArcGIS enables you to securely map your global addresses quickly and accurately behind your firewall. Global enterprises can input addresses from around the world and put them on a map using a single locator.

item.title: Esri
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Esri

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Websites
    • For the General Public
    • Specific for ArcGIS Users
    • Specific for ArcGIS Developers
    • For anyone (users, admins and developers) working with ArcGIS
  • Youtube channels
    • Product related
    • Country Specifics
    • Community channels
  • Twitter accounts
    • Corporative accounts
    • Product
    • Events
    • Teams
    • Programs
    • Training & learning
    • Topics
    • Other accounts
    • Esri Twitter lists
  • Github accounts
  • ArcGIS Online Users
  • Additional resources
    • Localized resources
      • Spanish

Introduction

Esri (Environmental Systems Research Institute) was founded in 1969 by Jack and Laura Dangermond. Today it software ( ArcGIS ) is been used by a 40% of the global market. The company have more than 350000 customers worldwide, 8000 employees, 1600 partners, 90 offices and $1.1B on revenue.

It organize multiple events annually and the biggest one (the User Conference in San Diego) brings together more than 15000 users. There is also a developer focused event, the Developer Summit, it take place at Palm Springs (USA) and Berlin (EU) every year.

Check this diagram to know more about the GIS and Esri evolution:

If you want to know more about ArcGIS capabilities, features, ... we encourage you to start checking some of these sites:

  • ArcGIS patterns and capabilities: analysis and planification, operational awareness, field data collection, assets management and community engagement | spatial analysis, real time, big data, 3D, imagery and sensors, etc.
  • ArcGIS features: content ready to use, visualization, spatial analysis, team administrations, apps, tools for developers, etc.
  • How GIS works: five steps: ask, collect, examine, analyse and act.
  • Esri Map Book: Esri Map Book showcases maps and applications that use ArcGIS to evaluate the sustainability of resources, determine efficient transportation routes, mitigate the effects of natural disasters, and much more

Learn more about:

  • Esri Startup program
  • Esri's Open Vision
  • Community: developer initiatives, international program managers, etc.
  • Events: hackathons and developer events
  • R&D Centers in North America, Europe, Australia, Asia and Africa
  • Brand: colors, logos, etc.

Websites

First thing you will notice when entering to "the Esri World" is the tons of resources and websites (+200 domains) that are available to you. This page aims to help you better understand which they are and what they are about.

Note: there still many domains missing in this page, we will try to extend it as soon as possible.

Note 2: we are not considering the +80 Esri distributors websites like UK, Spain, France, etc.

For the General Public

This domains collect general information, news and sample apps anyone could be interested when trying to understand what Esri and ArcGIS, some also include open datasets anyone could use and community initiatives anyone could join.

Domain Description
www.esri.com Information about the company, products, Industries, etc.
blogs.esri.com Esri Blogs about: products, labs, communities, training, ...
blog.esri.com The Esri blog tells stories about the unique way that GIS connects seemingly unrelated information through the common attribute of location. Keep up-to-speed on the latest applications of GIS.
www.arcgis.com This is our product called ArcGIS Online (our cloud product)
hub.arcgis.com This is our product called ArcGIS hub which can be adquired with ArcGIS Online
coolmaps.esri.com A collection of creative maps that use the Esri Mapping Platform to demonstrate how solutions can be enriched with the power of location
esri.com/products/maps-we-love Another collection of awesome maps
maps.esri.com Esri’s Applications Prototype Lab site. It showcases our latest demonstrations, prototypes and proof of concepts
pdx.esri.com Esri Portland R&D Center
dc.esri.com Esri R&D DC

Specific for ArcGIS Users

If you are an ArcGIS administrators or a desktop users you will find specific tutorials, support pages, tools and documentation on these domains.

Domain Description
learn.arcgis.com Guided lessons (tutorials) based on real-world problems
my.esri.com Support page for Esri Customers
resources.arcgis.com Non developer documentation for ArcGIS Products
help.arcgis.com It is no longer updated. Moved to doc.arcgis.com
marketplace.arcgis.com Third party applications
pro.arcgis.com n.a.
server.arcgis.com n.a.
landsatexplorer.esri.com Users draw on Landsat's different bands to better explore the planet's geology, vegetation, agriculture, and cities. Additionally, the app offers instant access to the entire Landsat archive, allowing users to visualize how the Earth's surface has changed over the last forty years.

Specific for ArcGIS Developers

If you are a developer you will find documentation, tutorials, tools and sample codes in these domains.

Domain Description
developers.arcgis.com Developer documentation
developers.arcgis.com/labs Developer tutorials
https://developers.arcgis.com/rest/ n.a.
github.com/esri Github Account
ago-assistant.esri.com n.a.
terraformer.io n.a.

For anyone (users, admins and developers) working with ArcGIS

No matter what's your job, you will find documentation, courses, books, community pages, tools, ... for ArcGIS users on this domains.

Domain Description
doc.arcgis.com Landing page with links to every product's documentation page
training.esri.com Free courses and paid courses
esripress.esri.com Esri Press publishes books and tutorials on GIS, cartography, and the application of spatial analysis. All publications are available to purchase online.
esri.com/mooc Esri massive open online courses (MOOCs)
community.esri.com Esri Community Site
earlyadopter.esri.com Early adopter community
codesharing.arcgis.com Interface to help anyone to find code samples hosted as items in ArcGIS Online (equivalent search)
proceedings.esri.com Official channel to host the slides of every Esri Event but also to find User Groups
support.esri.com Technical articles, white papers, patches, software updates, product lifecycles, system requirements
video.esri.com Video portal mixing content hosted by itself and our Youtube channels.
enterprise.arcgis.com n.a
geonet.esri.com Alias of community.esri.com
forums.esri.com Alias of community.esri.com
beta.esri.com Alias of earlyadopter.esri.com

Youtube channels

You can also find more information on any of our Youtube Channels:

Name Subscribers Topics (Playlists)
Esri Events +4425 >23 playlists: 2017 Developer Summit Plenary, ...
ArcGIS +3500 >35 playlists: Insights, GeoDev Webinar Series,...
Esri Industries +1300 >23 playlists: Goverment, Public Safety, Water
EsriTV +800 >8 playlists: ArcGIS Pro, Esri 2017 Federal GIS Plenary, ...
Esri R&D Center +180 Few videos
Esri Applications Prototype Lab +130 +40 videos
ArcGIS Maps for Office 95 7

Product related

  • AppStudioForArcGIS at Esri
  • CityEngineTV
  • Pro SDK Channel

Country Specifics

Official distributor channels

  • Esri UK
  • Esri Australia
  • Esri Canada
  • Esri Spain (Spanish)
    • GeoDevelopers (Spanish Developer Program Channel, mixes languages: Spanish & English)
  • Esri France (French)
  • Esri Deutschland (German)

Community channels

Esri employees:

  • Rene Rubalcava
  • Hussein Nasser
  • Andrew Turner

Team Channels

  • Esri Education Team
  • Esri GeoDev Team

Twitter accounts

Corporative accounts

Account Description
Esri Esri users create maps that run the world. ArcGIS an open platform for: GIS, 3D, Imagery, Apps, Iot, Cities, BigData, Geodesign, TheScienceofWhere
Esri Blog The Esri Blog relates innovation in the real world to the power of GIS.
Esri Globe News on GIS and smart mapping from Esri (subscribe - esri.com/esri-news)
Esri Support Esri Support Services provides world-class support to help our customers. Via Twitter, we'll share info about Esri's online support resources and more! - support.esri.com
Esri Careers Connect with us for insight into the #EsriExperience! - esri.com/careers
Real-Time GIS n.a.

Product

  • ArcGIS Companion
  • ArcGIS Earth
  • ArcGIS Javascript
  • ArcPy
  • ArcGIS Apps
  • AppStudio for ArcGIS
  • ArcGIS Enterprise
  • ArcGIS Living Atlas of the World
  • ArcGIS Online
  • ArcGIS Hub
  • ArcGIS Pro
  • ArcGIS Runtime
  • ArcGIS Explorer
  • Esri Storymaps
  • ArcGIS Ideas

Events

  • Esri DevSummit
  • Esri User Conference
  • Esri Petroleum

Teams

  • Esri GeoDev
  • Esri Interactive
  • ArcGISTeamLocalGov
  • ArcGIS for State Gov
  • Esri GIS Education
  • Esri Business Team

Programs

  • Esri Startup Program
  • Esri Partner Network

Training & learning

  • Esri Training
  • Learn ArcGIS
  • Esri Library
  • Esri Press
  • Esri MOOCs
  • What it GIS?

Topics

  • Esri Environment
  • Esri Public Safety
  • Esri Community Development
  • Esri Public Works
  • Esri Forestry Group
  • Esri Water
  • GIS and Science

Other accounts

  • GeoNet
  • Esri DC
  • Esri PDX
  • Esri Geospatial
  • Esri Mapping Center
  • Esri Young Pros
  • Esri WAsia|ME|Africa

Esri Twitter lists

  • EsriGeoDev/esri-accounts.

Github accounts

  • Esri Inc Official
  • Esri R&D DC
  • Esri R&D PDX
  • Esri R&D Beijing
  • Esri Colombia
  • Esri Netherlands
  • Esri Spain
  • Esri UK
  • Esri UK Map Labs

ArcGIS Online Users

Esri own many ArcGIS Online organizations, and each of them have many users. Some of those users are used for personal use and some of them to publish team work under the same username. So Esri share items by one or another way: using organizations groups or team users.

Here we will focus on team users but you can list User's groups from their profile (click on: View User's Groups):

  • Esri
  • esri_en
  • esri_3d
  • esri_vector
  • esri_maps
  • esri_dm
  • ArcGISEarthTutorials
  • esri_imagery_workflows
  • ArcGISTeamAnalysis
  • 3DGISTeam
  • ImageryWorkflowsTeam
  • RasterDevTeam
  • ArcGISTeamLocalGov
  • Esri_Technical_Marketing ...
  • Content:
    • Esri_LivingAtlas
    • esri_demographics
    • esri_basemaps
    • esri_imagery
    • esri_osm (OpenStreetMap)
    • esri_atlas
    • esri_oceans
    • esri_landscape2
    • esri_transport
    • esri_landsat
    • esri_modis
    • esri_observations
    • esri_hydro
  • Products & Product teams:
    • esri_promaps
    • esri_collector
    • Survey123forArcGIS
    • esri_dashboard
    • GeoEventTeam
    • StoryMaps
    • Scene Viewer
    • esri_solutions
    • ArcGISRuntimeSDK
    • EsriAndroidTeam
    • EsriQtTeam
    • ...
  • Distributors:
    • EsriUKContent
    • EsriUKedteam
    • EsriUKEdContent
    • EsriEspanaContenidos
    • esri_es
    • EsriContenidos
    • Esri_NL_Tools
    • Esri_Japan
    • ...
  • ...

Additional resources

Localized resources

Spanish

  • Sobre Esri

item.title: 3D Data
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

3D

Table of contents

  • Introduction
    • Videos
  • Products
  • Localized resources
    • Spanish

Introduction

ArcGIS allows you to generate your own 3D models from cadastral track, OSM, lidar, laser, CAD, BIM or even images taken with drones, edit them, symbolize them, perform analysis and share them as a 3D service (in ArcGIS Enterprise or ArcGIS Online), or as a compressed scene layer package, which can be viewed in ArcGIS Pro or ArcGIS Earth. In the web part remember that we have the scene viewer, templates, Web AppBuilder 3D, and the new JavaScript API 4.3. Using the Javascript API we can create 3D apps with feature service, 3D spatial analysis, dynamic dashboards, filters and ranges, etc.

Some examples:

  • Campus 3D Viewer
  • 3D Public Survey
  • C-Through
  • Crime trends

Videos

Chris Andrews made this awesome playlist: 2018 Esri 3D GIS with +10 short videos (~5min) explaining core concepts.

We have also created a 3D on the ArcGIS Platform Youtube playlist that we think it might be worth to you to save (how to save a Youtube Playlist).

You might also find interesting videos at Esri Industries, ArcGIS, EsriTV, Esri R&D Center etc

Products

All these products work and support 3D:

  • New generation of Runtime SDKs and APIs
  • ArcGIS Pro
    • 3D Analyst
  • City Engine
  • ArcGIS Online and Enterprise
    • Scene Viewer
    • Web AppBuilder
  • Drone2Map
  • ArcGIS VR
  • ...

Localized resources

Spanish

Web Esri España: ArcGIS > Capacidad 3D:

  • El valor del GIS en 3D. Regreso al futuro. - CEsri18
  • Webinar 3D, BIM y Gestión Indoor

item.title: Big Data
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Big data

Big data is data sets that are so voluminous and complex that traditional data-processing application software are inadequate to deal with them. Big data challenges include capturing data, data storage, data analysis, search, sharing, transfer, visualization, querying, updating, information privacy and data source. | Source: wikipedia.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Technology
    • Esri products
    • Other tools an projects
  • Training
    • Documentation
    • Videos
    • Slides
  • Awesome projects and cool demos
  • Support and Community
    • People you should know
  • News
  • Additional resources
    • Localized resources
    • Other related list of resources
  • Partners and startups
  • Contributions

Introduction

Big data use to be related IoT in the platform, but that's not always the case, for example, some times it is also related with the management of vast amounts of images.. That's why we have created a separated page for ArcGIS and IoT.

Technology

Tools and products to work with big datasets.

Esri products

Based on your needs There are a set of technologies in the ArcGIS platform you might want to know if you are interested in this topic:

  • Storage, search, querying & updating data -> Spatiotemporal Big Data Store: we offer the spatiotemporal big data store to enable archival of high volume observation data, sustains high velocity write throughput, and can run across multiple machines (nodes). But ArcGIS is also compatible with other storage technologies like Apache Hadoop.

  • Capture, transfer, sharing -> GeoEvent Server: enables you to work with real-time mapping and analytics. It works with: MongDB, Hadoop, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, etc.

  • Data analysis:

    • Vector Data (Real-Time) -> GeoEvent Server
    • Vector Data (Batch) -> GeoAnalytics performs analysis with large volume of data
    • Raster Data (Batch) -> ArcGIS Image Server provides serving, processing, analysis, and extracting value from massive collections of imagery, rasters, and remotely sensed data.

  • Visualization -> JavaScript API and SDK Runtimes, (learn more about the developer tecnologies).

Note: ArcGIS API for Python: the arcgis.geoanalytics module provides submodules, data types, classes and functions to process your big data using an ArcGIS GeoAnalytics Server (more info)

Other tools an projects

  • GIS Tools for Hadoop
  • Spark projects from Mansour Raad
    • spark-pip: Spark job to perform massive Point in Polygon (PiP) operations
    • spark-gdb: A library for parsing and querying an Esri File Geodatabase with Apache Spark.
    • Spark SQL DBF Library: Spark SQL DBF Library
    • SparkProject: Using Apache Spark in an ArcMap Toolbox
    • dbscan-spark: DBSCAN implementation using Apache Spark
    • hdfs-geohex: (Web)Mapping Elephants with Sparks
    • Spark, Cassandra, Tessellation and ArcGIS](Spark, Cassandra, Tessellation and ArcGIS
    • ...

Training

  • An Introduction to Big Data (by Esri)
  • GIS Tools for Hadoop for Beginners
  • New Spatial Aggregation Tutorial for GIS Tools for Hadoop
  • Tutorial: Run a GeoAnalytics tool
  • From the Big Data Blog at GeoNet
    • Aggregating layers using GeoAnalytics
  • How to read and write layers in pyspark using the Run Python Script task through the REST API in ArcGIS Enterprise

Note**: Check for specific training about GeoEvent, GeoAnalytics, Spatiotemporal Big Data Store and ArcGIS Image Server on their respective pages.

Documentation

  • GeoEvent Server input connectors (Kakfa, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, ...)
  • Get started with big data file shares in GeoAnalytics Server (ArcGIS Enterprise)

Videos

On video.esri.com and Esri Events you will find many technical talks. Or check Esri Geodev channel for short videos.

Event Title Length
DevSummit 2018 Real-Time and Big Data GIS: Best Practices 57min 31secs
DevSummit 2017 Automating Distributed Raster Analysis using the Image Server REST API 30min 25secs
DevSummit 2017 Real-Time Data and Big Data GIS at a Massive Scale 58min 19secs
DevSummit 2017 Big Data: Using ArcGIS with Apache Hadoop 24min 37secs
DevSummit 2017 Visualizing Big Data with the ArcGIS API for JavaScript and WebGL 46min 25secs
FedGIS 2013 Big Data in ArcGIS 5min 17secs

You might also find interesting videos at Esri Industries, ArcGIS, EsriTV, Esri R&D Center etc

Slides

More slides in proceedings.esri.com or check on GeoNet.

Awesome projects and cool demos

  • GeoAnalytics at DevSummit Plenary 2019

  • Raster Analytics at DevSummit Plenary 2019

  • Spatial Big Data Solution: Airbnb Los Angeles

  • Taxi Cab Terrain: Millions of Cab Rides Over One Year Paint a Portrait of New York City
  • Big Data Analytics on Citi Bike

Note: Check also the cool demos and projects at GeoEvent, GeoAnalytics, Spatiotemporal Big Data Store and ArcGIS Image Server pages.

Find more BigData use cases here.

Support and Community

If needed, remember you can always check the Technical Support Website for developer products and the Technical Support Blog at GeoNet to find additional resources.

Community channels:

  • Big Data GeoNet Group
    • Answered questions
  • GIS Tools for Hadoop issues

Is there any category on ArcGIS Ideas on GeoNet for this topic?

Vote/share the ideas about Big Data @ [ArcGIS Ideas on GeoNet](https://community.esri.com/search.jspa?q=Big Data&place=%2Fplaces%2F478947&depth=ALL)

People you should know

Please find the ArcGIS Experts on this topic using this tool:

They don't work on the support team and some may even not work at Esri, but they are opening some projects and sharing insights related to this technology so we recommend you to follow them.

You can also explore the experts in the Awesome ArcGIS organization in ArcGIS Online.

News

  • Big Data at esri.com search engine
  • Blog Posts about Big Data inside Places at GeoNet

Additional resources

Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "big data".

Localized resources

  • Taller de GeoaAalytics de un día
  • IoT y Big Data: los mejores aliados
  • Cómo adoptar una estrategia de éxito en Big Data y Artificial Intelligence con AWS - CEsri17

Other related list of resources

  • Performance:
    • ArcGIS performance
    • Learn more about how the ArcGIS API for Javascript is using WebGL, the GPU, WebAssembly, HTTP2, Protocol Buffers (pbfs), a client side geometry engine, etc. to deliver a high performance experience | JSAPI performance
    • ArcGIS and High Performance Computing (HPC)
  • Imagery data
  • Other emerging technologies related:
    • Artificial intelligence
    • IoT-Real Time

Partners and startups

Organizations and the type of relation with this product:

Company Relation type Country
Safegraph Startup United states

Is there any partner or startup you can had with expertise with this product?, learn how to contribute in less than a minute

Contributions

Feel free to improve/extend this resource page using this template (Contribution Guide).

item.title: BIM
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

BIM

Building information modeling (BIM) is a process involving the generation and management of digital representations of physical and functional characteristics of places. | Source: wikipedia.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Training
    • Videos
    • Slides
  • Community
    • People you should know
  • News
  • Additional resources
    • Localized resources
      • Spanish
  • Partners and startups

Introduction

A new collaboration between Autodesk and Esri will put GIS and BIM at the center of construction projects, driving smarter decisions, optimized designs, accelerated project approvals, reduced cost, creating smarter cities and resilient infrastructure. Building the bridge between GIS and BIM will change the way we plan, design, and build our future (more info).

Training

Read the ArcGIS Tools for BIM storymap.

Videos

We have created a BIM Youtube playlist that we think it might be worth to you to save (how to save a Youtube Playlist).

Check also this BIM Youtube Playlist from Don Khuene.

On video.esri.com you will find many technical talks.

Event/Date Title Length
Dec. 2017 Esri China - 3D BIM Example 46 secs
DevSummit 2017 GIS, BIM, and Indoor Mapping 29min 48secs
GeoDesign Summit 2011 Getting Real with GeoDesign and BIM 1h 0min 55secs
GeoDesign Summit Summit 2010 Practical Considerations for Integrating BIM and GIS 9min 3secs

Slides

  • Strategies for Integrating CAD and BIM in ArcGIS - Esri
  • GIS, BIM, and Indoor Mapping - Esri
  • Geodesign: Concept for Integration of BIM and GIS in Transportation projects
  • Your Perfect 3D World (BIM and GIS Integrated)
  • Planning, 3D GIS & BIM, and project information management & collaboration
  • Advanced Data Interoperability: LiDAR, 3D, and BIM - Esri
  • Multimodal stop place accessibility and indoor way finding (from 2D CAD or point cloud data to 3D BIM through GIS tools
  • GeoDesign – Concept for Integration of GIS / BIM in Landscape Planning
  • 3D in the ArcGIS Platform
  • GeoDesign Apps and 3D modeling for the Smart City Cologne

More slides in proceedings.esri.com or check on geonet.

Community

If you need help you should probably go to the 3D group on GeoNet and mention one of the experts on GeoNet.

You might also find some Q&As on Stackexchange.

People you should know

Please find the ArcGIS Experts on this topic using this tool:

They don't work on the support team and some may even not work at Esri, but they are opening some projects and sharing insights related to this technology so we recommend you to follow them.

News

  • News about BIM at blogs.esri.com
  • Blog Posts about "BIM" inside Places at GeoNet
  • etc

  • Community
    • People you should know
  • News
  • Additional resources
    • Localized resources
      • Spanish
  • Partners and startups

Introduction

A new collaboration between Autodesk and Esri will put GIS and BIM at the center of construction projects, driving smarter decisions, optimized designs, accelerated project approvals, reduced cost, creating smarter cities and resilient infrastructure. Building the bridge between GIS and BIM will change the way we plan, design, and build our future (more info).

Training

Read the ArcGIS Tools for BIM storymap.

Videos

We have created a BIM Youtube playlist that we think it might be worth to you to save (how to save a Youtube Playlist).

Check also this BIM Youtube Playlist from Don Khuene.

On video.esri.com you will find many technical talks.

Event/Date Title Length
Dec. 2017 Esri China - 3D BIM Example 46 secs
DevSummit 2017 GIS, BIM, and Indoor Mapping 29min 48secs
GeoDesign Summit 2011 Getting Real with GeoDesign and BIM 1h 0min 55secs
GeoDesign Summit Summit 2010 Practical Considerations for Integrating BIM and GIS 9min 3secs

Slides

  • Strategies for Integrating CAD and BIM in ArcGIS - Esri
  • GIS, BIM, and Indoor Mapping - Esri
  • Geodesign: Concept for Integration of BIM and GIS in Transportation projects
  • Your Perfect 3D World (BIM and GIS Integrated)
  • Planning, 3D GIS & BIM, and project information management & collaboration
  • Advanced Data Interoperability: LiDAR, 3D, and BIM - Esri
  • Multimodal stop place accessibility and indoor way finding (from 2D CAD or point cloud data to 3D BIM through GIS tools
  • GeoDesign – Concept for Integration of GIS / BIM in Landscape Planning
  • 3D in the ArcGIS Platform
  • GeoDesign Apps and 3D modeling for the Smart City Cologne

More slides in proceedings.esri.com or check on geonet.

Community

If you need help you should probably go to the 3D group on GeoNet and mention one of the experts on GeoNet.

You might also find some Q&As on Stackexchange.

People you should know

Please find the ArcGIS Experts on this topic using this tool:

They don't work on the support team and some may even not work at Esri, but they are opening some projects and sharing insights related to this technology so we recommend you to follow them.

News

  • News about BIM at blogs.esri.com
  • Blog Posts about "BIM" inside Places at GeoNet
  • etc

Additional resources

  • Adding Revit Models into ArcGIS Pro and ArcGIS Online
  • Check the Lidar page if you are interested in 3D Scanners

Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "BIM".

Localized resources

Spanish

Web Esri España: ArcGIS > Capacidad BIM

  • Playlist de Youtube: BIM Y ArcGIS
  • Webinar 3D, BIM y Gestión Indoor (2017)
  • BIM & Indoor, servicios i3s y realidad virtual, 3D en las nuevas tecnologías (2017)
  • Revisión PD Vitoria con la metodología BIM

Company Services Country

item.title: Imagery Data
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Imagery data

Many things can be done though imagery in the ArcGIS platform, here we will point you to many resources to learn more about that.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
    • Training
      • Videos
    • Content
      • Content providers
    • Related products or technologies

Introduction

Learn more about ArcGIS Imagery & Remote Sensing.

When working with imagery in the platform you can collect and view imagery content from Esri and Esri partners like:

  • High-Resolution Global Basemaps: Background imagery can serve as a canvas, providing context and validation for your GIS data.
  • Multispectral, Temporal, Dynamic Image Services: Dynamic image services suitable for visualization and analysis include Landsat, National Agriculture Imagery Program (NAIP), Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS), and elevation data.
  • Premium Imagery Content: Access current imagery without needing to manage it, including premium imagery from Nearmap and Hexagon.

But if you collect your own imagery, you can also use ArcGIS to process, analyze, and maintain it along with your raster data.

Training

  • The ArcGIS Imagery Book
  • MOOC: Earth Imagery at Work
  • Learn.arcgis.com (Category: Imagery and Remote Sensing)

Videos

We have created a Imagery Youtube playlist that we think it might be worth to you to save (how to save a Youtube Playlist).

On video.esri.com and Esri Events you will find many technical talks.

Event Title Length
DevSummit 18 Developing Imagery Apps Using the ArcGIS API for JavaScript and WebApp Builder n.a.
User Conference 17 Imagery Sources and Usage in ArcGIS 1h 12min 45secs

You might also find interesting videos at Esri Industries, ArcGIS, EsriTV, Esri R&D Center etc

Content

Learn everything about imagery type of content in the platform:

  • Existing data like: Landsat imagery, Sentinel imagery, MODIS data, ...
  • Supported data types
  • Data storage
  • Service types, etc.

Content providers

If you don't find what you need any Esri Office can help you reach a data provider.

Related products or technologies

There are several products you can use to work imagery content:

  • ArcGIS Pro
  • ArcGIS Spatial Analyst
  • ArcGIS 3D Analyst
  • ArcGIS Image Analyst
  • ArcGIS Image server
  • ArcGIS Earth
  • Drone2Map
  • ArcGIS Enterprise
  • ArcGIS Online

Introduction

What is a community?

A common definition of community emerged as a group of people with diverse characteristics who are linked by social ties, share common perspectives, and engage in joint action in geographical locations or settings. - Source: ncbi.nlm.nih.gov

So there are many ArcGIS users sharing content and helping each other on many channels, locations, ... Many Esri employees also participate on these communities in their spare time sharing contents, helping other users but also asking questions.

Here you will find a compilation of channels and contents.

Global communities

The official channel maintained by Esri for the global community of ArcGIS users is GeoNet, but there are other channel were you will find content generated by the community:

Community channel User type Contents
geonet.esri.com Any +250K Q&A, articles, ...
Youtube Any +250K videos
gis.stackexchange.com Any +40K Q&A
bit.ly/our-ideas Any +13K ideas
StackOverflow Developers +4.7K Q&A
esri.com/arcgis-blog Any +2.5K articles
github.com/esri Developers +1.1K Q&A

Emerging technologies

Learn how emerging technologies are been used by some ArcGIS users.

Table of contents

Introduction

Understand "emerging" as emerging in a GIS context/workflows:

  • 5G
  • 360
  • Augmented Reality (AR)
  • Artificial intelligence: machine learning, deep learning, ... for image recognition, chatbots, etc.
  • Indoor
  • IoT
  • Social networks
  • UAVs / Drones
  • Virtual Reality (VR)

If you want us to extend this list with any trend, please let us know.

item.title: 5 G
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

5G

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Additional resources
  • Related
  • Contributions

Introduction

Additional resources

  • NextTech: AI’s Role in the 5G Buildout

Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "5G".

Related

5G promise greater speed and data capabilities to any aspect of our lives, but 5G won’t automatically eliminate today’s deficiencies. Wireless providers will still be challenged to decrease dropped calls, reduce data latency and expand network coverage to more customers.

All this falls on a better planning, fulfillment and assurance of 5G networks, and that can be achieved through combination of AI, big data, predictive capabilities and spatial analysis tools.

Learn more at:

  • [Advanced Analytics for Network Strategy in ArcGIS]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NHFJV2y2_Nc)
  • Network Transformation

Contributions

Feel free to improve/extend this resource page using this template (Contribution Guide).

item.title: Artificial Intelligence
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Artificial Intelligence

Machine learning and deep learning can play a critical role in spatial problem solving in a wide range of application areas, from image classification to spatial pattern detection to multivariate prediction.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Training
    • Documentation
    • Tutorials
    • Videos
    • Slides
  • Coding
    • Code
    • Tools
  • Awesome projects
  • Community
    • People you should know
  • News
  • Additional resources
    • Localized resources
      • Spanish
    • Other related list of resources

Introduction

Machine Learning (ML) refers to a set of data-driven algorithms and techniques that automate the prediction, classification, and clustering of data.

Deep learning refers to a subset of machine learning composed of algorithms that permit software to train itself to perform tasks, like speech and image recognition, by exposing multilayered neural networks to vast amounts of data.

Note: you might also be interested in the Chatbots in the ArcGIS Platform page.

Training

Documentation

  • Blog article: Damage assessment using deep learning in ArcGIS
  • ArcGIS Pro docs: Analysis and geoprocessing > Image Analyst > Deep Learning
  • Learning path: Extracting Information using Image Classification

Tutorials

  • Identify trees on a plantation and measure their health using imagery using ArcGIS Pro (1h 40min)
  • Predict Seagrass Habitats using ArcGIS Pro (1h 30min)

Videos

We have created a Artificial Intelligence Youtube playlist that we think it might be worth to you to save (how to save a Youtube Playlist).

On video.esri.com you will find and Esri Events you will find many technical talks.

Event Title Length
DirectionsMag Webinar (2019) Adopt Deep Learning Workflows in ArcGIS for Faster Analysis 56min 48secs
DevSummit 2019 The Forest for the Trees: Making Predictions using Forest-Based Classification and Regression 52min 33secs
DevSummit 2019 Integrating Machine Learning and Deep Learning with ArcGIS 28min 36secs
DevSummit 2019 Deep Dive into Machine Learning in ArcGIS Platform 4h 25min 31secs
DevSummit 2019 Using Deep Learning Models with ArcGIS to Extract Information from Imagery 51min 21secs
DevSummit 2019 Deep Learning Powered by Raster Analytics 11min 27secs
DevSummit 2019 Machine Learning in ArcGIS 1h 18secs
DevSummit 2019 Accelerating Outcomes with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence 28min 51secs
DevSummit 2018 Artificial Intelligence with Geo 1h 4min 17secs
DevSummit 2017 Using Deep Learning to Extract Feature Data from Imagery 1h 3min 46secs
DevSummit 2017 Getting Data Science with R and ArcGIS 59min 39secs
User Conference 2017 Microsoft AI 4min 48secs

You might also find interesting videos at Esri Industries, ArcGIS, etc

Slides

Find slides in proceedings.esri.com or check on geonet.

Coding

Code

  • Sample of Jupyter Notebooks for GIS Analysts / Data Scientists
  • Rohit Singh: Some experiments with deep learning
  • Search: machine learning site:github.com

Tools

  • ArcGIS Pro Add-in. The Add-in allows you to perform an interactive clustering of points using a popular machine learning clustering algorithm called OPTICS

Awesome projects

You might find some: live previews, videos from Esri Events and Esri Industries.

Community

There is no specific group to talk about machine learning, so depending on what you are looking for we recommend you to search a place or group on GeoNet:

  • Python
  • ArcGIS API for Python
  • ArcGIS Pro
  • Imagery and Remote Sensing
  • R-ArcGIS
  • ...

People you should know

Please find the ArcGIS Experts on this topic using this tool:

They don't work on the support team and some may even not work at Esri, but they are opening some projects and sharing insights related to this technology so we recommend you to follow them.

News

  • GeoAI @ medium.com: thoughts about where AI and GIS intersect
    • Parking Lot Vehicle Detection Using Deep Learning
    • Swimming pool detection and classification using deep learning
    • Using Machine Learning to Predict Car Accident Risk
  • A new business intelligence emerges: Geo.AI
  • New Clustering Tools in ArcGIS Pro 2.1: More Machine Learning at your Fingertips

More news:

  • "machine learning" at blogs.esri.com
  • "machine learning" at esri.com search engine
  • Blog Posts about "machine learning" inside Places at GeoNet

Additional resources

  • Artificial Intelligence: A European Perspective

Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "machine learning".

Localized resources

Spanish

Noticias:

  • GeoAI: Inteligencia Artificial en ArcGIS
Title Length
DataScience Toolbox e integración con ArcGIS y Machine Learning 2 Nov. 2017
Cómo adoptar una estrategia de éxito en Big Data y Artificial Intelligence con AWS - CEsri17 2 Nov. 2017
Spatial Data Science con R 28 Jul. 2016

Other related list of resources

  • Chatbots in the ArcGIS Platform
  • A curated list of awesome Machine Learning frameworks, libraries and software.
  • MOOC:
    • EDX: Data Science: Machine Learning
    • Coursera: Data Science Specialization
    • Udacity: Machine Learning Engineer Nanodegree Program
  • Kaggle Machine Learning and Deep Learning tracks

item.title: Chatbots
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Chatbots

A chatbot (also known as a talkbot, chatterbot, Bot, IM bot, interactive agent, or Artificial Conversational Entity) is a computer program or an artificial intelligence which conducts a conversation via auditory or textual methods. | Source: wikipedia.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Training
    • Tutorials
    • Videos
  • Coding
    • Code
    • Tools
  • Awesome projects & cool demos
  • Community
    • People you should know
  • News
  • Additional resources

Introduction

At Esri different teams (Esri R&D DC Center, Esri Spain Tech and Innovation team, ...) have been prototyping different chatbots, here you will find some resources to help you understand those projects.

Training

Tutorials

How to get started developing your own bots:

  • The Complete Beginner’s Guide To Chatbots..
  • The Secret To Making Your Own Facebook Messenger Bot In Less Than 15 Minutes.
  • How to create a chatbot without coding a single line
  • How To Build Bots for Messenger.
  • Creating A Chat Bot.
  • A Beginner’s Guide To Your First Bot.
  • Pair Programming a Facebook Messenger Bot.
  • A beginner’s guide to your first bot
  • Facebook Chatbot Tutorial

Acknowledgment: This list has been extracted from https://github.com/hackerkid/bots#tutorials

Videos

We have created a GIS Bots Youtube playlist that we think it might be worth to you to save (how to save a Youtube Playlist).

On video.esri.com and Esri Events you could find more technical talks.

Event Title Length
DevSummit 2017 GeoBots: Making the World Accessible Through Ambient Interfaces 30min 56secs

You might also find interesting videos at Esri Industries, ArcGIS, EsriTV, Esri R&D Center etc |DevSummit 2017|GIS, BIM, and Indoor Mapping|29min 48secs

Coding

Code

Github:

  • sonar: Chat bot for asking questions about your community with ArcGIS Open Data
  • gis-talk-bot: It help anyone to search content within an ArcGIS organization

More at ArcGIS Search

Tools

Tools for building bots

Awesome projects & cool demos

  • Sonar presentation at Developer Summit 2017
  • GIS Talk bot by Esri Spain

Community

If you are looking for help on Chatbots in general you might ask on Stackoverflow, but if you are build an ArcGIS Chatbot you should probably ask your questions on the REST API group on GeoNet and mention one of the experts on GeoNet.

People you should know

Please find the ArcGIS Experts on this topic using this tool:

They don't work on the support team and some may even not work at Esri, but they are opening some projects and sharing insights related to this technology so we recommend you to follow them.

News

GIS talk bot - Hack the Map II hackathon results

Additional resources

Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "BIM".

    • Indoor Mapping - Premium Advertisement Location

People you should know

They don't work on the support team and some may even not work at Esri, but they are opening some projects and sharing insights related to this technology so we recommend you to follow them.

  • Indoor Location Prototype - 1st Feb 2018

More news:

  • "indoor" at blogs.esri.com
  • "indoor" at esri.com search engine
  • Blog Posts about "indoor" inside Places at GeoNet

Additional resources

Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "indoor".

Localized resources

Spanish

Live projects:

  • Rutas indoor Esri España
  • Responsive App 2D Indoor
  • ArcGIS Indoors - Gestión inteligente de los espacios
  • Operation Dashboard:
    • Gestión Smart Campus UNIZAR

Videos:

  • Indoor Location Intelligence - CEsri17
  • Webinar 3D, BIM y Gestión Indoor
  • BIM & Indoor, servicios i3s y realidad virtual, 3D en las nuevas tecnologías - CE17
  • Otros videos

Related technologies

Tools to create: 3D Virtual Tours, 3D indoor floor plans reconstruction, dollhouse views, etc.

  • AR Plan 3D Ruler – Camera to Plan, Floorplanner
  • Cupix.com: Capture a space in 3D without a 3D scanner create 3D tours and much more
    • More about: 3D indoor floor plans reconstruction from spherical panoramas: Agisoft, AliceVision, LayoutNet, etc.
  • Holo Builder
  • Matterport

Other related list of resources

  • 360º Pictures and videos in ArcGIS
  • Indoor mapping with ArcGIS Indoors and IMDF for Apple Maps: you can get FME for free for one year joining the Startup Program
  • You should also check the BIM resource page.

item.title: IoT & RT
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Internet of things (IoT) & Real-time (RT)

The Internet of Things (IoT) is the network of physical devices, vehicles, home appliances and other items embedded with electronics, software, sensors, actuators, and connectivity which enables these objects to connect and exchange data | Source: wikipedia.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Training
  • News
  • Real time content
    • Localized resources
      • Spanish

Introduction

IoT use to be related with Real-time and Big data in the platform, but that's not always the case, that's why we have created a separated page for ArcGIS and Big Data

There are a set of products in the ArcGIS platform you might want to know if you are interested in this topic:

  • GeoEvent
  • Spatiotemporal Big Data Store

Training

  • Mapping The Internet Of Things

News

  • Esri and PubNub Collaborate on Real-Time Location Strategy Technology for Developers of Next Gen Mapping and Analytics Apps

  • Twitter: @RealTimeGIS Real-Time GIS

Real time content

  • Real time content published in ArcGIS Online
  • Stream services published in ArcGIS Online

item.content:encoded:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Internet of things (IoT) & Real-time (RT)

The Internet of Things (IoT) is the network of physical devices, vehicles, home appliances and other items embedded with electronics, software, sensors, actuators, and connectivity which enables these objects to connect and exchange data | Source: wikipedia.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Training
  • News
  • Real time content
    • Localized resources
      • Spanish

Introduction

IoT use to be related with Real-time and Big data in the platform, but that's not always the case, that's why we have created a separated page for ArcGIS and Big Data

There are a set of products in the ArcGIS platform you might want to know if you are interested in this topic:

  • GeoEvent
  • Spatiotemporal Big Data Store

Training

  • Mapping The Internet Of Things

News

  • Esri and PubNub Collaborate on Real-Time Location Strategy Technology for Developers of Next Gen Mapping and Analytics Apps

  • Twitter: @RealTimeGIS Real-Time GIS

Real time content

  • Real time content published in ArcGIS Online

item.title: Virtual Reality
item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Virtual Reality Developers

Export 3D scenarios built using City Engine, export them to Unity and build your application using any VR SDK to finish the application for your VR headset.

Table of contents

  • Introduction
  • Training
    • Videos
  • Headsets
    • Oculus Rift
    • Samsung Gear
    • Cardboard
  • People you should know
  • Related resources
  • Additional resources

Introduction

This video can help you understand what can be done with ArcGIS and virtual.

To build you own applications using ArcGIS scenarios you first need to build the scenario using City Engine and then you will be able to export it and consume it using Unity.

Training

To be able to build your own VR applications using ArcGIS scenarios you should learn about City Engine and Unity:

  • Awesome list: City Engine
  • Awesome list: Unity assets, resources, and more
  • How to: CityEngine VR Experience for Unreal Studio

Videos

  • Creating LiDAR-Based Heightmaps in Unity 3D (Using ArcGIS)
  • The CityEngine VR Experience for Unreal Studio

Headsets

Here have collected some video and sample projects using different headsets.

Oculus Rift

  • Video: First Time with the Oculus Rift (ESRI CityEngine SIGGRAPH '13)
  • Video: IDEAbuilder - Digital Fabrication and Smart 3D City Models in Virtual Reality

Samsung Gear

  • App: ArcGIS 360 VR
  • Early Adopter Community - Esri Labs ArcGIS 360 VR

Cardboard

  • Project: VR Map Explorer: Google Cardboard SDK and Esri SDKs (on Android)
  • Video: Urban walkthrough

People you should know

Please find the ArcGIS Experts (story tellers and developers) on this topic here: https://esri-es.github.io/arcgis-experts/?topic=Virtual%20Reality%20(VR))

They don't work on the support team and some may even not work at Esri, but they are opening some projects and sharing insights related to this technology so we recommend you to follow them.

Related resources

Technologies:

  • Augmented Reality & ArcGIS
  • Mobile technologies - Runtime SDKs
  • Desktop technologies - Runtime SDKs

To learn or improve your skills with VR here check these curated lists of awesome resources about:

  • VR resources and projects
  • A-Frame, a web framework for building virtual reality (VR) experiences

Additional resources

Probably not all the resources are in this list, please use the ArcGIS Search tool looking for: "virtual reality".

item.description:
Note: this page is only a draft, but this project is hosted on a public repository where anyone can contribute. Learn how to contribute in less than a minute.

Events

Table of contents

  • Introduction
    • DevSummit
  • Hackathons
  • Local conferences

Introduction

Esri organizes dozens of events throughout the year:

  • User Conference
  • Developer Summit
  • Partner Conference
  • Business Summit
  • Federal GIS Conference
  • Ocean GIS Forum
  • Senior Executive Summit
  • Petroleum GIS Conference
  • etc.

DevSummit

You will find all the videos from the Palm Springs (California) Developer Summit as Esri Events playlists on Youtube.

These are the latests keynotes speakers:

  • 2019 - Glenn Vanderburg, Vice president of Firt-io
  • 2018 - Joseph Sirosh, Corporate Vice President in the Artificial Intelligence and Research group at Microsoft
  • 2017 - Todd Greene, CEO Pubnub
  • 2016 - Douglas Crockford, Author of JavaScript The Good Parts
  • 2015 - Chris Wanstrath, Github CEO

In addition to the conference in California, Esri organizes two other conferences for developers:

  • Esri Developer Summit D.C.
  • Esri European Developer Summit

Hackathons

Resources:

  • Esri Hackathon Resources by Max Payson
  • The Esri Hackathon Handbook
  • A place to learn how to build geo apps with the ArcGIS Platform.

Offtopic: Hackathon Organizer Guide

Local conferences

Simultaneously each country/region organizes it's own local conference:

  • Esri UK Annual Conference
  • Esri Spain User Conference
  • Australian Esri User Conference
  • ...
